intro: Cotoneaster vulgaris var. uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flowered cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring dense, thornless branches that bear alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during late spring, followed by red, berry-like fruits in autumn. Its foliage provides year-round interest, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, showing good adaptability to various climates.
